intro: Trimorpha compacta, commonly known as the compact daphne, is a perennial evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features dense, compact growth with small, glossy leaves that are typically dark green. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red, typically blooming in spring. Its foliage remains evergreen throughout the year, providing year-round visual interest. Trimorpha compacta is well-suited for rock gardens or containers due to its compact form and drought tolerance.
